div.l: Or of a sowter · a shipman or a leche
Sey furth thy tale and tarie nat the tyme
Loo Depford and it is half wey pryme
Loo Grenewiche whore many a shrewe is Inne
It were al tyme · thi tale to begynne
Now sirs · quod this Oswold the Reve
I pray yow alle · that ye nat a greve
For lieful is with fors · fors to shoove
Though I aunswer · and somdel sette his hove
This drunke Miller · hath I told vs here
How that beguyled · was a carpentere
ꝐParaduenture in scorn · for that I am oon
And bi yowre leeve · I shal hym qwite anon
Right in his cherol cherol termes · wil I speke
I pray to god · his necke mote to breke
He can wele in myn eye · see a stalk
But in his owne · he can nat seen a balk
¶Explicit prologus
AT Trumpyngton · nat fer from Cambrigge
Ther goth a brooke · and oủer that a brigge
Vpon the whiche brooke · ther stant a Melle
And this is verray soth · that I yow telle
A Miller was there dwellyng many a day
As any Pecok · he was prowde and gay
Pipen he cowde and fisshe · and nettis bete
And turne cuppes · and wele wrastel and sheete
And be his belt · he bare a long pavade
